candidates.reason: The comment directly discusses the topic's goals (wasting power and importance of power factor correction) and specific concepts (apparent vs real power, reactive power) mentioned in the description. The analogy used in the video is also referenced in the comment.
candidates.comment: This video is 11:25 minutes. What I learned from the video - This video talks about how AC to DC power supplies like the one show here for LEDs waste a lot of power. The apparent power vs the real power drawn is very different and that is bad. He then talks about what power factor correction circuits are and why they are important for fixing this issue. He uses a good analogy with pouring coke into a glass. Liquid coke is the real power, foam is the reactive power, and the total height is the apparent power. I don’t quite understand exactly how all this works. Circuits are not my forte, but I understood well enough that increasing the power factor of appliances saves energy in the long run.
